quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Area and Aka
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, world, county. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: There is an Area 52.
The 105 Freeway is AKA:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Glen Anderson Freeway

questions.question: The 91 Freeway is AKA The Riverside Freeway.
What is the airspace around Nellis Air Force Base called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Box

questions.question: Area 51’s primary purpose is to support development and testing of experimental aircraft and weapon’s systems.
If youre heading to Santa Barbara from LA Proper, its likely youll travel on the:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 101, or Ventura Freeway

questions.question: The 405 Freeway is AKA:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Diego Freeway

questions.question: How large is Area 51 all buildings included?

options.text: More than 3,000 but less than 6,000 sq miles

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: More than 3,000 but less than 6,000 sq miles

questions.question: Roswell Army Air Base was located in the middle of Area 51.
Which state is Detroit the capital of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: If Im having a Cholesterol Free snack (yeah, right) at Randys Donuts, at 805 Manchester Ave in Inglewood,  Im closest in proximity to which Freeway?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The 405, San Diego Freeway

questions.question: The 710, is AKA:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Long Beach Freeway

questions.question: The 55  in Orange County is known exclusively as the Costa Mesa Freeway.
If Im travelling from Placentia to Diamond Bar, I want to take the 57 (Orange) Freeway.
The Federal Government finally admitted Area 51’s existence in 1997.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Detroit and Japan
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, lakes, headquarters. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Detroit was established by French colonists. What does the name mean in French?
What is the name of Detroits MLB team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Detroit Tigers

questions.question: What family ruled Japan for many years, using a feudal system, until overthrown in 1868?
What is the name of the landmark office complex in downtown Detroit, where General Motors headquarters is located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Renaissance Center

questions.question: In which of these major American sports does Detroit have a professional team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of the following religions has the least number of followers in Japan?
Which of the following is the largest and most populous of the four main islands of Japan?
From which country was the Japanese writing system imported and adapted for the Japanese language?
Which district in downtown Detroit is famous for its restaurants and casino?
Which of these IT companies has its headquarters in downtown Detroit?
8 Mile Road in Detroit was featured in a movie about rapper Eminem. The road is 8 miles away from which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Campus Martius

questions.question: Detroit is on the northern bank of the Detroit River. Which of the following is located on the southern bank?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ontario, Canada

questions.question: Which automaker is NOT based in Detroit?
What is the name of the automated train that circles downtown Detroit?

options.text: SMART (Suburban Mobility Authority for Regional Transportation)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Detroit People Mover

questions.question: Which of the Great Lakes is closest to Detroit?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Languages and Language
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, bullet, commission. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What day was proclaimed an European Day of Languages by the Council of Europe?
What sport has six major tournaments a year in Japan, three in Tokyo and three in other major cities?
In the 1990s the site of the Tokyo Municipal government was moved to two tall twin towers located in which Tokyo municipality?
What political party started to dominate Japanese politics after the end of the US Occupation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liberal Democratic Party

questions.question: The European Commission conducts its internal business in these three languages, sometimes called procedural languages.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: English - French - German

questions.question: Socrates was a classical Greek philosopher and Leonardo da Vinci was an Italian painter, sculptor, architect, mathematician and inventor. What do they have in common?

options.text: They were both in love with Mona Lisa.
Leonardo da Vinci was one of Socrates students.
Some learning programmes of the European Commission are named after them.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Some learning programmes of the European Commission are named after them.

questions.question: The number of member states in the European Union exceeds the number of official languages, as several national languages are shared by two or more countries. Which official language is spoken in the greatest number of countries?
During mid-summer many Japanese return to their ancestral homes to pay homage to their departed family members. What is this custom called?
An alphabet is a standardized set of letters or the basic written symbols of a language. How many official alphabetic writing systems are used in the European Union?

The Common European Framework divides language learners into different levels based on what a learner is supposed to be able to do in reading, listening, speaking and writing. How many are the levels?
How many Japanese Emperors were there from the end of the feudal period in 1868 to 1989, when Akihito acceded to the throne?
Catalan, a language spoken by over 9 million EU citizens in the autonomous community of Catalan in Spain, became an official language of the EU in 2001.
What two languages are not official European Union languages, although they are official languages of some of the member states?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luxembourgish; Turkish

questions.question: Admiral Perry forced Japan to end its isolation policy in 1854 when his fleet sailed to Japan and made a show of force at this port city. A replica of one of Perrys steam powered black ships can be seen near the railroad station of the city.
To get from Tokyo to Osaka on the Shinkansen (Bullet Train) one must pass through which of the following cities?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: City and Puerto Vallarta
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, puerto. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Although it is the most populous of all American cities, where did New York City rank in 2005 compared to other big cities in the world?
What is the most widely spoken of the Slavic languages, and the largest native language in Europe?
Is there a restaurant  from the worldwide theme restaurant chain Planet Hollywood in Puerto Vallarta?
Puerto Vallarta is a popular gay travel destination.
What is the name of the main seaside strollway in the city of Puerto Vallarta?
The US Constitution requires the Federal Government to make regular censuses.
In 2003, what percentage of the Americans lived within 100 miles of an ocean?
From 1990 to 2001, what was the fastest growing religion in the USA?
Which city had the highest median income of any city in the USA for 2005?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fisher Island, Florida

questions.question: In 2005, of all American cities with a population of at least 450,000 people, which city had the biggest population density?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York City, NY.

questions.question: In 2005, New York City, Chicago, and Los Angeles were respectively the first, second and third most populous cities in America. Which city was fourth?
When did the population of the USA hit the 100 million mark?
Which state had the county with the lowest median family income for 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Dakota

questions.question: What is the average life expectancy for an American as estimated in 2007?
According to Leonardo Orban, the first Romanian EU Commissioner, this language is the ideal solution for the language problems in the EU, as it is a neutral, logical, easy-to-learn and rich.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Puerto Rico and Puerto Vallarta
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, puerto, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these is not a golf course in the Puerto Vallarta area?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: El Paso Golf

questions.question: What is Puerto Vallartas time zone?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: CST - Central Standard Time

questions.question: Celebrities such as actress Roselyn Sanchez(Rush Hour 2) and Ricky Martin(musician) were born in this famous city in Puerto Rico.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Juan

questions.question: This is the highest mountain in Puerto Rico; measuring 4,390 feet in elevation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cerro de Punta

questions.question: Built on 1963 in Puerto Rico, this is one of worlds largest radio telescopes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arecibo Radio Telescope

questions.question: The annual charity Becas Ball of Puerto Vallarta is held on what day of the year?

options.text: It is held on different days.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is held on different days.

questions.question: What types of whales can often be seen visiting the Bay of Puerto Vallarta during wintertime?

options.text: There are no whales in the region.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Humpback whales and orcas

questions.question: Which of the following is a folkloric genre of music native to Puerto Rico? Essentially utilizing maracas and percussion instruments.
Puerto Vallarta was once known as Las Peñas.
What is Puerto Ricos national anthem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: La Borinquena

questions.question: Which of the following movies, starring Richard Burton, was filmed in Puerto Vallarta?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Night of the Iguana

questions.question: This is Puerto Ricos national dish. The cuisine consists of pigeons peas and white rice mixed together; seasoned with a condiment called sofrito.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arroz con Gandules

questions.question: What does the name Irish Spring refer to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A soap brand

questions.question: Which is Puerto Ricos official currency?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: U.S. Dollar

questions.question: Puerto Ricos flag consists of which of three colors?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red, White,and Blue

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Philippines and Alcatraz Island
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, cone, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the capital of the Philippines?
On what continent is the Philippines located?
Roman Catholicism is the predominant religion in the Philippines.
What phrase means good morning in Filipino?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: magandang umaga

questions.question: What volcano in the Philippines is famous for its perfectly-shaped cone?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mayon Volcano

questions.question: The first Spaniard to discover Alcatraz Island named it La Isla de los Alcatraces which translates as what?

options.text: The Island of the Lost Souls

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Island of the Pelicans

questions.question: What is the highest mountain in the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mt. Apo

questions.question: Who made the following statement: I prefer a country run like hell by Filipinos to a country run like heaven by Americans. Because, however bad a Filipino government might be, we can always change it.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manuel Quezon

questions.question: When did Alcatraz Island become a federal prison?
La primavera, or Spring, is Concerto No. 1, in E major which is part of The Four Seasons violin concertos. Who composed The Four Seasons?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antonio Vivaldi

questions.question: Who is the first president of the 1st Philippine Republic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emilio Aguinaldo

questions.question: Who is the first woman president of the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Corazon Aquino

questions.question: What kind of animal is the Springbok?
What did Alcatraz serve as before becoming a federal prison?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: all of these

questions.question: Alcatraz Island, also referred to as The Rock, is located in the San Francisco Bay.
